channel.title: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site
channel.description:
Hi,
I have games on my site, and they are swf files, how do I stop people downloading them.
They do it like this:
lets say my website was:
www.musicmad.com, and the link was: www.musicmad.com/blabla, they would look in the source for the .swf file, and then do www.musicmad.com/blabla/blabla.swf, and then click ctrl + s and they could save it.
How do I stop this.
Thanks

item.title: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:5, topic:194064”]Make it to a EXE file, then its a little harder.
But people must download it to use it, but they can’t read the source code so easy.[/quote]
dont talk again…

Baros Rocks:

On www.mousebreaker.com if you try to run certain games off an alternate website, it’ll show up with ‘This game must be run off mousebreaker.com’

thats fixable sometimes by decompiling the swf

Read full topic

item.title: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Make it to a EXE file, then its a little harder.
But people must download it to use it, but they can’t read the source code so easy.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site

item.title: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

You take them off the Internet and destroy them permanently. The web is an open medium, people who do things like attempting to protect their HTML code are pathetic idiots. If I want to get your SWF file, and you allow me to play it in my browser, I WILL get it. It is literally impossible for you to stop somebody from getting it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site

item.title: How do I protect a swf file that im using on my site
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

the only thing I can think of is making it a php file that sticks a unique number into the database and use AJAX to get the SWF using that ID that is given, which the server will only let it be seen once.

Read full topic
